source: 211.org, NYC Department of Veterans Services, New York State Department of Veterans Services, VA, and veteran service organizations

resources.name: New York State Department of Veterans' Services
resources.address: 2 Empire State Plaza, 17th Floor, Albany, NY 12223
resources.description: State-level veterans benefits advising and advocacy services with a network of field offices across New York

resources.name: NYC Department of Veterans' Services
resources.address: 201 Varick St Room 4W59.30, New York, NY 10014
resources.description: Comprehensive city-level veteran services coordinating housing, employment, mental health, food assistance, and legal support

resources.name: VA Manhattan Vet Center - PTSD & Counseling
resources.description: Free confidential PTSD and mental health counseling in non-medical setting with same-day crisis appointments available

resources.name: Services for the Underserved (S:US) - SSVF Housing Program
resources.address: 17 Battery Place, Suite 732, New York, NY 10004
resources.description: Supportive Services for Veteran Families (SSVF) offering rapid re-housing, homelessness prevention, and housing stability assistance

resources.name: Services for the Underserved (S:US) - SSVF Long Island
resources.description: SSVF housing assistance and employment services for Long Island veterans and families

resources.name: Jericho Project - Veterans Initiative
resources.address: 245 West 29th Street, Suite 902, New York, NY 10001
resources.description: Comprehensive support for over 700 veterans including supportive housing, employment training, mental health services, and SSVF assistance

resources.name: Black Veterans for Social Justice (BVSJ) - Veterans Service Center
resources.description: Employment placement, VA benefits counseling, housing assistance, interview support, and food pantry for all veterans

resources.name: Volunteers of America - SSVF Housing Program NYC
resources.description: SSVF provider offering housing assistance and supportive services for veteran families

resources.name: HelpUSA - SSVF Housing Program
resources.description: SSVF provider offering rapid re-housing and homelessness prevention services for veterans

resources.name: Veteran Outreach Services Center (VOSC) - Buffalo SSVF
resources.description: Buffalo-area SSVF offering homelessness prevention and rapid re-housing with comprehensive support services

resources.name: City Bar Justice Center - Veterans Assistance Project
resources.description: Legal support for VA disability benefits claims with pro bono attorney volunteers; recovered over $7.5M in benefits for 1,500+ veterans

resources.name: Legal Services NYC - Veterans Justice Project
resources.description: Free legal services for veterans facing eviction, disability benefits issues, mental health challenges, and civilian reentry problems

resources.name: New York Legal Assistance Group (NYLAG) - Veterans Rights
resources.description: Civil legal services addressing economic, racial, and social justice issues for veterans in poverty or crisis

resources.name: Volunteers of Legal Service (VOLS) - Veterans Initiative
resources.description: Free legal services for senior veterans (60+) including wills, powers of attorney, and advance directives from pro bono lawyers

resources.name: God's Love We Deliver - CONNECTED Program
resources.description: Free medically tailored meals and nutrition counseling for veterans with chronic illness or behavioral health conditions

resources.name: Feed Our Vets Food Pantry
resources.description: Food pantry dedicated to serving veterans and low-income individuals with free groceries

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line
resources.description: 24/7 confidential support via call, chat, or text for veterans in crisis

resources.name: New York-Presbyterian Military Family Wellness Center
resources.description: Telehealth, individual, group, and couples therapy for veterans and military families

resources.name: NYU Steven Cohen Family Center
resources.description: Free comprehensive care for veterans and military families including mental health services

resources.name: Headstrong - Veteran Mental Health
resources.description: Online mental health treatment for current and new veteran clients with telehealth appointments

resources.name: Trauma and Resiliency Resources (TRR)
resources.description: Free behavioral health services and residential programs for combat veterans of all eras

resources.name: Vets4Warriors
resources.description: 24/7 confidential peer support network for veterans

resources.name: IVMF Onward to Opportunity (O2O)
resources.description: Free career training program providing professional certifications and support services for transitioning veterans

resources.name: NPower Tech Fundamentals
resources.description: Free 6-month technology training program for veterans, reservists, and military spouses

resources.name: Edge4Vets - Fordham University
resources.description: Program helping veterans identify military skills and translate them to civilian employment

resources.name: New York State Department of Labor - Veteran Employment Services
resources.description: Priority employment services including job training, disabled veterans outreach program (DVOP), and local veteran employment representatives (LVER)

resources.name: VA Benefits Administration - New York Regional Office
resources.description: Federal VA services for benefits administration, disability compensation, education, home loans, and vocational rehabilitation

resources.name: VA Homeless Hotline
resources.description: 24/7 hotline for veterans experiencing homelessness to access shelter, housing, and support services

resources.name: HUD-VASH Housing Program
resources.address: NYC and statewide through local housing authorities
resources.description: Federal housing voucher program for homeless veterans providing rental assistance

resources.name: NY Emergency Housing Assistance
resources.description: Emergency housing expense assistance for veterans in housing crisis

resources.name: NYC Housing Connect
resources.description: Affordable housing lottery portal with priority consideration for veterans
